page.title: 09Old Hall Bird Reserve
page.content: Old Hall is the largest marshland in Essex, it is 1,134 acres. Three quarters is rough grazing the rest is marshland, crops and salt_marsh islands. Last winter the Royal Society for the Protection of Birds bought Old Hall as a bird reserve. Here are some sea and estuary birds you might see:_Waders, Dunlin, Oyster_catchers, Curlews, ringed and grey Plovers, reed Buntings and Gold finches. Brent geese come in winter. Their population in Britain is 10 times greater than in 1953, now they are protected. in spring they fly back to Russia and Siberia to nest. Autumn and Winter are the best times to see wading birds at the reserve.
